output: Rainbow Dash: I thought Pinkie Pie said to get here right away.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Uh, Pinkie? You said you had something important to tell us.
output: Pinkie Pie: Not telling so much as showing. In fact, what you're about to see may shake the very foundations of your perception for all time!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I think Applejack's asking about the part about Cheese Sandwich and your life's purpose.
output: Pinkie Pie: Oh, that. Yeah. It's just... All of you have found your thing. You're gonna rule all of Equestria, Rainbow Dash is a Wonderbolt, Fluttershy has her animal sanctuary, Rarity has her boutiques, Applejack has the hat... And the farm! So that's like... two things! I don't even have one. When I first got Cheese's invite, I was a little jealous. It felt like even he was moving on to bigger and better things. And everypony was leaving me behind. But then I realized Cheese Sandwich is a party pony just like me. If he figured out his purpose, he can help me figure out mine.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I think talking to Cheese Sandwich is a great idea. But the only pony who can really find your life's purpose is you.
output: Pinkie Pie: I know, silly. That's why I'm going to visit Cheese Sandwich's factory so I can ask him to help me.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Well, that sounds like quite a trip!
output: Fluttershy: And Cheese Sandwich just left his own factory?

input: Twilight Sparkle: I have to admit I was a little shocked when Princess Celestia told me she wanted to start a scholastic buckball league. But I was even more surprised that she wanted the first game to be between her school and ours! Apparently, she's a huge sports fan.
output: Pinkie Pie: Always thought Celestia was kind of a jock, just with really wavy hair.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I know how you feel. Young athletes ready to take the field. Ooh, you could almost breathe in the excitement!
output: Snails: I don't think you should breathe it in so hard.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Relax. You're gonna do just fine.
output: Fluttershy: Um, what makes you so sure?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Because I have faith in my friends, who also happen to be the best buckball players in Equestria!
output: Pinkie Pie: Oh, yeah!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I asked Rainbow Dash to help, too. But I'm not sure when she—
output: Rainbow Dash: Sorry I'm late! But when Twilight said she needed my help with the buckball team, I figured I'd better grab every piece of coaching equipment I could find! So what should I focus on? Offense? Defense? Trick plays?

input: Twilight Sparkle: I was thinking of something even more important.
output: Rainbow Dash: Awesome! Lay it on me. Whatever it is, I'll give it a hundred and twenty percent!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I knew I could count on your enthusiasm! That's why I want you to coach the cheer squad!
output: Rainbow Dash: Cheerleading?!

input: Twilight Sparkle: The cheer squad is important.
output: Rainbow Dash: Oh. Well, sure, cheer squad is totally important to somepony who isn't me. But I'm more about ponies playing in the game, not cheering for it.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Hmmm. Well, maybe this will be a good opportunity for you to find out.
output: Rainbow Dash: Of course I've seen cheer squads before – on the sidelines – but I'm not even a hundred percent sure what they do. I'll probably just mess it up.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I think you might be surprised. In fact, I'm more sure than ever that you're the perfect choice.
output: Snips: I'm actually one hundred and twenty percent sure. And it's a good thing, too. The cheer squad really needs you.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Yahoo!
output: Princess Celestia: I realize the game of buckball traditionally requires an Earth pony, a Pegasus, and a unicorn, but I appreciate you allowing my students to compete.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Of course, and the wings and magical-dampening ring you made seem to be working really well.
output: Princess Celestia: Indeed, though not as well as your team. COME ON, SCHOOL OF MAGIC!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Wow, Rainbow Dash! It's almost like you were the perfect pony to coach cheer squad after all!
output: Rainbow Dash: Wait a second. Was this one of those things where you knew the lesson I needed to learn before I learnt it?

input: Twilight Sparkle: You mean like how you don't have to care about a thing other ponies like as long as you care about the ponies who like it? Nope. Don't know what you're talking about.
output: Rainbow Dash: Ugh!

input: Twilight Sparkle: ...going to bed! Brains need eight hours of sleep to perform at optimum levels!
output: Spike: Oh. Cool. I thought I'd have to force you to go to bed since tomorrow is your chance to be the first pony to win Ponyville Trivia three times in a row. That is tomorrow, right?

input: Twilight Sparkle: ...yes! Ask me another one.
output: Spike: Another what?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Another question! I want to stay in the zone. That way, I can sleep in the zone! Wake up in the zone! And be totally in the zone tomorrow!
output: Spike: Uh, this is a whole new level of "Twilight-ing", isn't it? Heh.

input: Twilight Sparkle: ...yes!
output: Spike: Are you okay?

input: Twilight Sparkle: ...yes!
output: Spike: Well, good night, Twilight. Good luck with your brain sleep and getting that third win.

input: Twilight Sparkle: ...good night! And yes!
output: Spike: That wasn't a question.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I'm glad you decided to come watch your first Trivia Trot, Spike. I hope the rules aren't too confusing.
output: Spike: Rules? Isn't trivia just asking questions and answering them?

input: Twilight Sparkle: "...participating in Trivia Trot." And that wraps up rule forty-one point six. Of course, the exception to that – rule forty-one point six A – is interesting itself because—
output: Spike: Oh, look! We're here!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Ooh! I can't wait to see who my partner's gonna be!
output: Spike: You don't get to pick your own team?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Rule twenty point one six B, Spike. To keep things fair, the teams are randomly selected.
output: Spike: Twenty point one six B. How could I forget?

input: Twilight Sparkle: And based on the regular attendees, I've charted every potential teammate's strengths and weaknesses, plus my percentage of winning with each one!
output: Spike: Ha! I knew there'd be a chart! Glad I'm just watching. I don't think I could handle being your teammate. What if I let you down?

input: Twilight Sparkle: You could never let me down, Spike. But I'm glad you're watching, too. I'm going to need all the support I can get for win number three!
output: Applejack: Well, well, well, if it ain't our reignin' champ. Think you can win again this week, Twilight?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Everypony here has a different area of expertise, so it really is anypony's game. But yes!
output: Rainbow Dash: Then you better hope you get paired with me, because I am gonna rule this game!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Rule thirty-seven point two C. No back-to-back categories. But I think Fluttershy was joking.
output: Pinkie Pie: Sure sounded like a joke to me! Woo-hoo!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Pinkie Pie?!
output: Pinkie Pie: Present!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I hadn't anticipated Pinkie Pie as a potential player! She's never played before! My chart is completely off! I have no way to predict what'll happen, and unpredictable is not good for a Trivia Trot three-peat!
output: Spike: Do I have to do that thing where I list all your successes as Princess of Friendship to put things into perspective and remind you this is just a game?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Spike! This has nothing to do with being the Princess of Friendship! And this is not just a game! This! Is! Trivia Trot!
output: Granny Smith: Okay, settle down, everypony. I'm fixin' to pick these here teams.

input: Twilight Sparkle: It's starting! I have to reevaluate my chart! Spike, I need you to find the part on matchups! Can you look outside?
output: Spike: What'd I miss?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Granny's about to call out the fifth team. Sunburst gave me the highest chance of winning, but he's been paired with Cranky Doodle!
output: Cranky Doodle Donkey: What? Who's that?

input: Twilight Sparkle: And apart they'll spend all their energy trying to one-up each other, so that only helps my chances.
output: Bulk Biceps: Let's do this! Yeah!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Eh, not every team is a threat, but there aren't many ponies left.
output: Granny Smith: All righty, hold on to your horseshoes, 'cause the next pair of players is... Maud and Mudbriar!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Oh, no! According to my calculations, the only pony who could really threaten my winning streak is...!
output: Granny Smith: And our final pair of contestants for this week's Trivia Trot is... Twilight and Pinkie Pie!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Yeah. Great.
output: Spike: So, I'm guessing the one pony who could mess up your winning streak is Pinkie?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Pinkie, I'm glad you're excited, but tonight's game is special. I could be the first pony ever to win three consecutive Trots in a row. And I'm really hoping I do.
output: Pinkie Pie: You don't have anything to worry about. I'll do everything I can to be the bestest and most funnest teammate ever.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I know I can. Pinkie might not be the partner I expected, but I can coach her along. And besides, I'm pretty good at this game. If she misses a few, I'm sure I can pick up the slack.
output: Pinkie Pie: Let's get this party started!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Ooh! A category about books! We're off to a great start!
output: Granny Smith: Who is the pony that despises the holiday season in the old classic A Hearth's Warmin' Tale?

input: Twilight Sparkle: It's fine, Pinkie. But maybe it'll help our chances if I coach you as we go. Tip one – try sitting still.
output: Pinkie Pie: Can do, Coach Twilight—

input: Twilight Sparkle: And don't get distracted. Or be distracting. Oh, and remember to listen carefully. Also, it's best to keep quiet between questions.
output: Pinkie Pie: Got it.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Pinkie!
output: Pinkie Pie: What?!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Okay, Pinkie. Remember, the category is "Apples". Keep your mind on apples.
output: Pinkie Pie: Apples, apples, apples, apples... Ooh, and oranges. And grapes! And strawberries. Strawberry cupcakes! I'm hungry.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Come on, Pinkie, you know this one. Mysterious apples? Only around for five days?
output: Pinkie Pie: Quiet down there. Pretty sure there's a rule against tummies ringing in.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Spike! I don't think I can coach Pinkie well enough for us to get my three-peat! I don't want her to feel bad! She's trying so hard, but I might have to start answering everything myself!
output: Pinkie Pie: Look, Twilight! No more belly growl interruptions for Team Twi-Pie!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Or... I should look at how everypony else is playing.
output: Granny Smith: Hope you're all in your seats 'cause the break is over, and it is time for more questions. Let me see, uh... How do you say "reward" in Olde Ponish?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Sunburst's partner is sleeping. And according to rule fifty-seven point six, sleeping on the table is subject to dis-qual-i-fi-ca-tion!
output: Granny Smith: Oh, looky here. That's an actual rule. Cranky is disqualified. I'm sorry, Sunburst. Without your teammate, you can't play neither.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Don't worry, Pinkie. We're not out of this game yet.
output: Fluttershy: Is the answer carrots?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Ah! Rule thirteen point two! No help from pets!
output: Applejack: Nyah!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Motion to establish new rule! No expressionless contestants!
output: Granny Smith: Nice try.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Fine.
output: Granny Smith: The next category is... "Cupcakes"!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Suuuure! Just when we're finally back in the game! Why, that sounds perfect, Pinkie, but... Ooh! Isn't that a confetti appreciation parade I see?
output: Pinkie Pie: Where?!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Double midnight chocolate fudge with chili pepper frosting!
output: Granny Smith: Correct!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Sorry, Pinkie. But you were looking at the parade, and I didn't want our team to miss out on the point.
output: Pinkie Pie: I guess that makes sense, but which way did that confetti parade go anyway?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Bananaaaaas!
output: Granny Smith: The category is "Sticks and Stones".

input: Twilight Sparkle: I don't know anything about those! That's not any kind of category!
output: Mudbriar: Technically, it's a kind of category where we know the answers and you don't.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Gee, Pinkie! I forgot the name of that famous rock in Griffonstone. Could you ask Maud?
output: Pinkie Pie: You got it! Hey, Maud! What's the name of the famous rock in Griffonstone?

input: Twilight Sparkle: I'm sorry, Pinkie. Guess I forgot about that rule.
output: Pinkie Pie: Oh, no! If I'm out, you don't have a partner! You won't be able to get your third win!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Actually, since there's another player who has also had his teammate disqualified...
output: Sunburst: Rule nineteen point seven B, whereby players whose teammates were disqualified may form a new team.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Oh, we're gonna crush this round!
output: Sunburst: I don't know, Twilight. You seem out of the zone today. But don't worry. I can pick up the slack.

input: Twilight Sparkle: What?! I am the reigning Trot champ! If there's any slack that needs picking, I'll be the up! I mean, wait...
output: Sunburst: I'm just saying you seem a little frazzled, and I do have a correct answer percentage to maintain.

input: Twilight Sparkle: That would be Lord Tirek!
output: Mudbriar: Technically, that answer is incomplete. The answer is Lord Tirek and Scorpan.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Look, Sunburst. I realize I may have been a little off earlier, but I'm really good at this game.
output: Granny Smith: How many holes are there in Daring Do's hat?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Well, I knew it, too. You're not the only pony to ever read a book, you know?
output: Sunburst: You're right, Twilight. I'm sorry. But now that I think about it, I'm not so sure about Dash's answer. Could you do a quick fact check?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Are you trying to get me disqualified?! What kind of pony would do that to their own teammate?!
output: Sunburst: You're right, Twilight. I don't know what got into me. I was so focused on my correct answers, I wasn't thinking straight. Can you forgive me?

input: Twilight Sparkle: It's okay, Sunburst. I understand. And I have a teammate of my own to apologize to. Lucky for you, Cranky's awake. And according to rule fifty-seven point six B...
output: Sunburst: Players previously disqualified for sleeping may rejoin the game. Provided they're well-rested.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Pinkie, you were the best teammate I could ask for, but I let wanting to win keep me from seeing that.
output: Pinkie Pie: I knew you wanted to win, but I probably could have helped a little. And even if I couldn't...

input: Twilight Sparkle: ...we still could've had fun. I'm so sorry for not realizing it. I got so obsessed with one thing, I forgot what really mattered.
output: Pinkie Pie: No! That doesn't sound like you at all!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Well, win or lose, nothing is more important than my friend. Or my team. Twi-Pie forever?
output: Pinkie Pie: I-I don't know.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I understand. I guess even the Princess of Friendship can mess things up with her friends.
output: Pinkie Pie: Oh, it's not that. It's just that I already changed it to Team Twi-Burst, and now I guess I should change it to Sun-Doodle?

input: Twilight Sparkle: According to rule thirteen point two, players can join the game at any time, provided they start from zero.
output: Pinkie Pie: Wow. These rules are really convoluted. But doesn't starting from zero mean we'll lose?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Well, our chances aren't good, but the odds of having fun on Team Twi-Pie are one hundred percent!
output: Granny Smith: What is the name of the Ponyville Day Spa's most popular candle?

input: Twilight Sparkle: That was a joke. I wanted to show you with the Summer Sun Celebration how much I've improved. So I focused on delegating and trusting others. It's been great!
output: Princess Luna: That's... actually what we came to talk to you about. This may be the last Summer Sun Celebration you'll need to plan.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Did I do something wrong?
output: Princess Celestia: Of course not. It's just that the Celebration has always been about us. My defeat of Luna...

input: Twilight Sparkle: Now that you're...
output: Princess Celestia: My sister and I have decided. The time for us to retire is upon us. You and your friends have proven you are ready to lead Equestria. So let this be the last Summer Sun Celebration as Equestria leaves behind the old to embrace the new!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I'm actually fine. But if this is gonna be the last Summer Sun Celebration, I want to make sure it's the best Celebration ever!
output: Rainbow Dash: Please-don't-give-us-more-work... Please-don't-give-us-more-work... Please-don't-give-us-more-work...

input: Twilight Sparkle: So, even though everything was done, I thought of a few last-minute changes I could use your help with.
output: Rainbow Dash: I knew it!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I guess some draconequus isn't the know-it-all he thinks he is.
output: Rainbow Dash: This is it?

input: Twilight Sparkle: What?
output: Rainbow Dash: We were kinda with Discord on this one.

input: Twilight Sparkle: No more crazy lists. No more freaking out. With your help, I know we've got this.
output: Discord: Character growth is so boring. Do I at least get my own note card?

input: Twilight Sparkle: There. Now, I need to go rewrite my speech. But if you all look at your cards, you'll see—
output: Discord: Can't talk now. Have so much to get done before sunrise.

input: Twilight Sparkle: It's all coming together. I really think this is gonna be the best Summer Sun Celebration ever!
output: Rarity: You've done an outstanding job.

input: Twilight Sparkle: We've all done an outstanding job!
output: Discord: And what about me? You'll be happy to know that I have been watching myself all night, and I have yet to do one "Discord-y" thing.

input: Twilight Sparkle: That's... a good idea. Thank you all so much.
output: Applejack: I sure am proud o' her.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Do about what?
output: Spike: What are you doing here?

input: Twilight Sparkle: I forgot these. You guys okay?
output: Applejack: Twilight, w-we're sorry, but—

input: Twilight Sparkle: I guess I was too organized. I'll try to come up with a few last-minute errands for you before sunrise.
output: Rainbow Dash: Well, that's a relief!

input: Twilight Sparkle: You two just enjoy the festivities. I have a few surprises in store for— Yes, Discord?
output: Discord: Oh, well, don't mind me. I'm just here for the chaos.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Pinkie, is this soup?
output: Pinkie Pie: Yes! I... was really hungry?

input: Twilight Sparkle: What is?
output: Feather Flatterfly: That!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Applejack, what is going on?
output: Applejack: I told y'all this was a bad idea! But nopony ever listens to me!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I thought everything was fine! What is going on?!
output: Applejack: Everythin' was goin' fine.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Why didn't you tell me?
output: Rainbow Dash: We didn't want you to freak out.

input: Twilight Sparkle: And you thought not telling me everything was a total disaster would avoid a freak-out?!
output: Spike: When you say it like that, it sounds like a really bad plan.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I know how I used to react, but I really have changed. Panicking won't solve anything. But we can handle whatever problems come our way as long as we handle them together!
output: Princess Celestia: Spoken like a true leader. How can we help?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Because there is something even more important to celebrate. There are two ponies who have watched over us night and day for as long as we can remember. We will no longer commemorate their battle or their reunion. Instead, we will take this day to celebrate how much they mean to all of us. From this day forward, today will be known as the Festival of the Two Sisters!
output: Princess Celestia: We don't know what to say.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I'm just glad we pulled it off.
output: Applejack: About that... We just wanted to say we're real sorry.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Good. Because I'm sure there's gonna be plenty of things I'll need my best friends' help with.
output: Pinkie Pie: Whee-hee!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Do you know what he's trying to say?
output: Spike: Nope.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Sorry, Angel. You should probably find Fluttershy. If I see her, I'll let her know you're looking for her.
output: Zecora: Quite a day, my fuzzy friend. Did things work out for you in the end?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Um, hi, Rarity. What's up?
output: Rarity: Ugh! Besides my mane? Well, that is a question for Spike.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Oh. Well, Spike isn't here. I think he's at the post office.
output: Rarity: Again?! What is it with Spike and the post office?!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Rarity, what's going on?
output: Rarity: Spike declined my invitation to the gem cave, and I intend to find out why.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Hmm. That doesn't sound like Spike. Did you two have some sort of fight?
output: Rarity: A fight? Goodness, Twilight. What in Equestria would we fight about?

input: Twilight Sparkle: I've had arguments with friends before, and they can put a real strain on friendships.
output: Rarity: Well, certainly. But I think I'd remember if we had an argument.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Maybe you didn't realize it? Do you think you could've done something that unintentionally hurt his feelings?
output: Rarity: Well, if I didn't realize what I did, how would I know what I have done when I did it? I wonder if that's it. It certainly would explain his behavior. I must apologize!

input: Twilight Sparkle: For what?
output: Rarity: Oh, pfft. That's hardly the point. Poor Spikey-Wikey! This calls for a grand gesture!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Okay. Good talk.
output: Gabby: Wow! That's a big crate of stuff you're mailing.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Hi, Spike.
output: Spike: Uh-huh...

input: Twilight Sparkle: Hmmm. I've never seen Spike this sad before. Do you know what happened?
output: Rarity: Yes, well, perhaps he's still just tired from Power Ponypalooza.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I don't think that's it.
output: Rarity: I... suppose... it's possible it could have something to do with... Gabby not wanting to spend time with him anymore.

input: Twilight Sparkle: What? I thought the two of them were hanging out all the time.
output: Rarity: They were! Honestly, it took everything I had to convince him to spend any time with me at all! But between crystal gem crevasses, Power Pony conventions, and a marathon game of O&O, I managed to get some time in.

input: Twilight Sparkle: It sounds like you made sure he didn't have any time to spend with Gabby at all.
output: Rarity: What?! Pfft! I most certainly did not!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Friendships change, but just because Spike made a new friend doesn't mean he stops being yours.
output: Rarity: I know, but now I have to share him! Which I suppose I'll have to get used to. Right after I fix the mess I've made!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Good talk.
output: Gabby: Rarity? Is all this stuff for Spike again? Wouldn't it be easier to just give it to him? And why are you even here?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Starlight, I have something very important to discuss with you.
output: Starlight Glimmer: If this is about leaving early yesterday, I didn't have any students on my schedule, and Trixie was having a magical emergency, which actually turned out to be nothing—

input: Twilight Sparkle: It's not anything like that.
output: Spike: "Twilight Sparkle, the Princess of Friendship, in light of her impending ascension to the throne of Equestria and in anticipation of her many duties and responsibilities forthwith, does hereby intend to make good on her previous offer to you, Starlight Glimmer, of replacing her as headmare of the School of Friendship!"

input: Twilight Sparkle: I want you to take over the school when I move to Canterlot.
output: Starlight Glimmer: I know! It's just so... amazing! I'm a little... Do you think I'm really up for it? Of course you do. I've covered for you every time you've had to run off and save Equestria, but... I mean... Yes. Of course! Thank you!

input: Twilight Sparkle: You're welcome. And I can't think of anypony who'd be better for the job.
output: Starlight Glimmer: I'm a little nervous. And excited. I'm mostly just nervous.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I understand. Of course I'll have a lot of important responsibilities as ruler of Equestria, but I'll always be available to help whenever you need.
output: Spike: Are you supposed to be at a royal etiquette lesson with Celestia and Luna right now?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Right! Can't underestimate the important responsibility of royal napkin placement.
output: Starlight Glimmer: Wow. I mean, no biggie. Right, Phyllis? I've totally got this.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Getting royal place settings just right is a lot harder than it looks.
output: Starlight Glimmer: Okay... Uh, I know how busy you are, but I wanted to talk to you about running the school because, honestly, I was a bit worried about taking it over all on my own. But I just realized you never did it alone.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Having a friend help out is pretty great.
output: Starlight Glimmer: Exactly! So, what do you think about me hiring a vice headmare to help run things?

input: Twilight Sparkle: I trust you to run the school any way you want. And if that means hiring a vice headmare, I think it's a great idea.
output: Starlight Glimmer: Really?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Like you said, I've always had ponies around to help. And don't worry. You can always call on me to—
output: Spike: Uh, Twilight? Rarity says you were supposed to be at the boutique five minutes ago for your second fitting for the coronation gown.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Ugh. How many fittings are there gonna be?
output: Spike: A lot?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Anyway, good luck finding your vice headmare. I know you'll pick the right pony for the job.
output: Trixie: Wow. I heard the whole thing. And all I can say is I am humbled.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Starlight? I just thought I'd check in to see how the search for a vice headmare was going.
output: Starlight Glimmer: A lot better now.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Okay...
output: Starlight Glimmer: I really wanted it to be a friend, so I ended up pushing aside some pretty big signs that it wasn't gonna work out.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Not everypony is right for every job, but everypony has something to contribute. The trick is figuring out what.
output: Starlight Glimmer: What if you and your friend can't figure it out?

input: Twilight Sparkle: If you have a job to do, you have to decide what's best and be upfront and honest, even if that means you can't work with a friend on it.
output: Starlight Glimmer: So, I guess that means talking to them at the beginning instead of stringing them along until you get so frustrated you totally lose it and say a bunch of really awful things?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Pretty much.
output: Starlight Glimmer: Trixie? I know you're in there.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I'm afraid I am. Star Swirl sent me this enchanted flower, and it isn't doing well. If I figure out its magical properties, maybe we can save it.
output: Scootaloo: So that's a "no" on going with us to the fair?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Oh, definitely. You could take the wrong train or miss your stop...
output: Fluttershy: Or get lost in a strange town and end up in a dangerous situation with nopony to help you.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I know it's hard, but sometimes you just can't do what you want.
output: Scootaloo: I'm pretty sure if you wanted to go to the fair, you could.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Sure, grown-ups can do a lot of things that foals can't. But there's plenty we can't do either. Like right now, I can't find a single reference to this flower!
output: Fluttershy: None of the birds or insects I've talked to have heard of it either.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I wonder if there's anything in Shadetail Evergreen's Tome of Flora and Fauna?
output: Fluttershy: That book's pretty out of date, but it might be worth a try.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I think there's a copy in the library filed under "Discontinued But Still Potentially Useful Ancient Texts". Unless I put it under "Hokum With a Slight Chance of Practical Applications".
output: Apple Bloom: I guess this flower is the most interestin' thing we're gonna see today.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Well, once we read Shadetail Evergreen's warning that the flower grants wishes, it wasn't a stretch to think they wished themselves to the fair. It's all they were talking about.
output: Fluttershy: Or maybe, since we told them they were too young to come, they wished to become grown-ups, then came here and caused some kind of trouble that led to a town-wide panic!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Yeah. Or that.
output: Apple Bloom: Twilight! Fluttershy! Thank goodness! I know you're not gonna believe it, but it's me, Apple Bloom!

input: Twilight Sparkle: You all go look for Spur. Fluttershy and I will do our best to keep everypony here safe.
output: Spur: That's Bloofy?!

input: Twilight Sparkle: They sure aren't, but young foals pretending to be grown-ups are even less so.
output: Spur: What do you mean?

input: Twilight Sparkle: There's only one petal left. But I think the three of you know what to wish for. And I'm pretty sure Star Swirl won't mind.
output: Cutie Mark Crusaders: We wish we were foals again.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I'm glad you learned something. That's what growing up is. Which is why you probably shouldn't skip any of it.
output: Sweetie Belle: I know we didn't make the best impression, but we sure would like to visit you and Bloofy some day.

input: Twilight Sparkle: About what?
output: Spike: Oh, I don't know. It's not every day the princesses that have ruled Equestria for hundreds of moons retire and pass all their responsibilities on to your and your friends.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Oh, that. Actually, I'm feeling pretty good. We've all faced so much and come out okay. I know we're up to the challenge of keeping Equestria safe and happy. There's nothing we can't handle together. Which reminds me...
output: Spike: Royal advisor? What's that?

input: Twilight Sparkle: A new position I created for you. You've been at my side for every step of this journey. Knowing I had you to count on gave me the strength I needed to grow and succeed. I wouldn't be here without you.
output: Spike: Thanks, Twilight. You know I'll always be your right-hoof dragon.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I was hoping you'd say that. Because now that my crown's been fitted, we have some royal errands to run!
output: Rarity: And you're sure this is where Pinkie told us to get the blackberries for her special coronation dessert?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Is that before or after the royal marshmallow-eating-contest gown?
output: Rarity: What?! I haven't made one of those! You must tell me when they add these sorts of things!

input: Twilight Sparkle: It's okay, Rarity. I was just joking.
output: Spike: Joking? Day of her coronation? You've come a long way, Twilight.

input: Twilight Sparkle: What was that about?
output: Rarity: You know designers. Don't like being interrupted when they're on a creative roll. With thread this exquisite, can you blame them?

input: Twilight Sparkle: You're right. I'll just have to let everypony know that even with Celestia and Luna gone, we'll make sure things stay the same.
output: Applejack: Twilight! There you are! You mind tellin' your friend here that I don't need an official guard wherever I go? Especially if he ain't gonna help carry apples?

input: Twilight Sparkle: I appreciate you taking such good care of my friends, but we're fine now.
output: Applejack: It was the strangest thing. He kept callin' me "Earth pony", like I didn't have a name. And watchin' me like he thought I'd steal the silver!

input: Twilight Sparkle: You sure this is just pre-coronation nerves?
output: Discord: My aching metatarsals! You know, you forget how convenient snap-travel is.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Except it was all a lie.
output: Discord: A well-intentioned lie.

input: Twilight Sparkle: You've been setting up challenges for us the whole time, haven't you? None of our successes were actually real.
output: Discord: Of course they were! You just had an extremely good-looking safety net.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I... I need some time to think first.
output: Discord: Well, there isn't any time! Look what I overheard them saying!

input: Twilight Sparkle: How?! Stopping Sombra by himself was hard enough! And that was with lord-of-chaos training wheels!
output: Princess Celestia: Twilight, it doesn't matter if Discord set up your successes or not. We believe in you and always have.

input: Twilight Sparkle: The ultimate battle for the fate of Equestria is coming!
output: Cozy Glow: We're not going anywhere until you two stop arguing! Chrysalis, say something nice about Tirek.

input: Twilight Sparkle: We've faced enemies of Equestria before. And we've always succeeded, no matter the odds. That wouldn't be possible without all of you.
output: Discord: You're welcome!

input: Twilight Sparkle: So I ask for your help again today in what is our biggest battle yet. All of Equestria is at stake, and I can't do this alone. But I'm not afraid. Because with friendship as our armor and teamwork as our power, nopony can ever bring us down!
output: Cozy Glow: Oh, come on!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Cozy Glow?! You're—!
output: Cozy Glow: About to wipe the floor with you!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Aah!
output: Cozy Glow: Wow! It's true! Alicorns really do have more fun!

input: Twilight Sparkle: NO!
output: Cozy Glow: That's the problem with you magic-types. You're so reliant on all your special power, you forget to use your brains!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Keep telling yourself that! Now!
output: Cozy Glow: Whoaaaa!

input: Twilight Sparkle: You can attack us and we may fall. But Equestria will still stand, united in friendship. And we won't stop until we defeat you, no matter how many ponies you take down!
output: Lord Tirek: Didn't you all notice something was wrong in Equestria? We've been busy.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Aah!
output: Lord Tirek: 'Cause when you have to protect yourself, you don't have time for anypony else.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Huh?
output: Rarity: Go, Twilight! Get help!

input: Twilight Sparkle: No! I can't leave you here!
output: Fluttershy: It's our only chance!

input: Twilight Sparkle: You've been setting up challenges for us the whole time, haven't you?
output: Discord: My bad.

input: Twilight Sparkle: The ultimate battle for the fate of Equestria is coming!
output: Applejack: We'll hold 'em 'til you get back!

input: Twilight Sparkle: You're here?! I was so worried! Where are the princesses?
output: Pinkie Pie: They put up a crazy fight so we could escape and find you! Mission accomplished! Now let's save Equestria! Whoo-hoo-hoo-hoo! Yeah!

input: Twilight Sparkle: They made a terrible mistake. You all did. From the second I got away, I've been searching every book, scroll, and spell for a way to rescue you and stop Chrysalis, Tirek, and Cozy, but I haven't found anything. I failed.
output: Spike: You'll come up with something. We can't save Equestria without you.

input: Twilight Sparkle: You all escaped without my help. You didn't need me then. So why would anypony need me now?
output: Rainbow Dash: We know things look bad, but we've been in tough spots before, and we always—

input: Twilight Sparkle: Look around! Nothing we've ever done has mattered! Sombra? Returned and destroyed the Tree of Harmony! Chrysalis, Tirek, Cozy Glow? Returned and more powerful than ever! The School of Friendship? Shut down! Everypony in Equestria is so blinded by fear, they can't remember what friendship is! Nothing we do makes any difference!
output: Pinkie Pie: But we're still free and together.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I've already done enough.
output: Applejack: You want the truth, Twilight? Bad things happen. No matter what you do, there's never gonna be a time when everything's perfect. But that don't mean you quit tryin'!

input: Twilight Sparkle: What if I make things worse?! Ever since Celestia told me I was taking over, I've been gaining confidence. Then I find out it's all a lie. Equestria's been falling apart around us, and I didn't even notice! What kind of princess does that make me? I'm scared.
output: Fluttershy: I probably know more about being scared than anypony. But thanks to all of you, I've learned I'm always less scared when I'm with my friends.

input: Twilight Sparkle: But we're on our own, and we have no idea what to do!
output: Pinkie Pie: That's true pretty much every time something terrible is about to happen.

input: Twilight Sparkle: We don't have the Elements of Harmony anymore. How can you all be so calm about this?
output: Spike: Because, even if you don't believe you can do this, we do. We believe in you. In us.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Thank you. Sometimes even the Princess of Friendship needs a reminder that there's more to the Magic of Friendship than rainbow lasers.
output: Spike: Although that part is pretty cool.

input: Twilight Sparkle: We still need a plan.
output: Princess Cadance: That sounds like the pony I used to foal-sit for. Count us in.

input: Twilight Sparkle: No. You need to stay here and protect Flurry Heart. If we don't... If things don't work out, she's Equestria's last hope. Okay. Three of our worst villains have taken over, powered up by ancient magic. Everypony in Equestria is so scared and divided that the windigos are circling. And it's up to us to fix it all.
output: Pinkie Pie: What are we gonna do, Twilight?!

input: Twilight Sparkle: The same thing we do every time, Pinkie. Try to save the world!
output: Lord Tirek: Every prisoner is safely in their cells. Now we can hunt down the rest of the— Windigos?

input: Twilight Sparkle: That bell has Discord, Celestia, and Luna's magic inside. If they use it against us—
output: Fluttershy: Discord's magic is so chaotic, he's the only one who can use it.

input: Twilight Sparkle: You can't beat us if we never give up! As long as I have my friends by my side, I'll put my faith in friendship—
output: Cozy Glow: Ugh, can we get on with this please?

input: Twilight Sparkle: We need to get that bell and get Discord and the princesses their magic back. Rainbow Dash, Pinkie, you're with me.
output: Rainbow Dash: Sweet! I'll grab that bell in ten second—!

input: Twilight Sparkle: No. We're the distraction. They're gonna get the bell.
output: Queen Chrysalis: Come out, come out, wherever you are!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Please! Don't hurt him!
output: Spike: Don't worry about me! Just save—!

input: Twilight Sparkle: It's not me!
output: Lord Tirek: Don't let them escape!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I don't understand. How are you all here?
output: Gallus: That's kinda our fault.

input: Twilight Sparkle: ENOUGH! Because of you, I almost lost my way! But everycreature here has reminded me of the true power of friendship! There will always be darkness in the world, but there will also always be those who find the light! The Pillars knew this! That's why they created the Elements of Harmony! The Elements showed me and my friends how strong our friendship could be! Together we worked to bring harmony to Equestria! But there will always be more to do! Which is why we teach others about the Magic of Friendship! Others who will continue our mission after we are gone! Now I truly understand! The Elements were just symbols! The real magic has always been right here! And the more who understand how powerful friendship is, the stronger we will all be! Together!
output: Cozy Glow: This is bad, isn't it?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Pinkie! You took Discord's magic from the bell?! How do you feel?
output: Pinkie Pie: Hmmm... Tingly. Itchy. Also like...

input: Twilight Sparkle: You know what? I think I am.
output: Applejack: Thank goodness. First question, your Highness. What do we do with all these creatures?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Actually, as ruler of Equestria, I'd like to postpone the coronation for a while. At least until the castle's rebuilt. Besides, there's something we need to do first.
output: Rarity: Post-apocalyptic donuts. Interesting choice.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I know. But there's gonna be plenty of time for all the challenges and struggles and adventures to come. For now, I just want to spend a quiet moment with the six best friends I've ever had.
output: Applejack: Well, mostly quiet.

input: Twilight Sparkle: All I know is whatever comes next is going to be perfect.
output: Spike: How do you know that?

input: Twilight Sparkle: With you guys by my side, how could it not?
output: Future Spike: I got here as soon as I could, but friendship ambassador is a full time job these days. Making peace between Abyssinians and the Diamond Dogs has not been easy.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I'm just doing a final check, Spike.
output: Spike: But we did a final check. Of every room. Twice.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Ah-ha! See? An issue of Power Ponies. Now, aren't you glad we triple-checked?
output: Spike: Thanks, but I already read this one. I don't need to take it to Canterlot.

input: Twilight Sparkle: No-no-no! You love Power Ponies. We're taking it.
output: Spike: Really, Twilight, we don't have to bring the comic. I'm not even sure how much longer I'll collect them. A lot is changing, and I am getting older.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Just because things change doesn't mean you leave everything you love behind!
output: Spike: You're not still worried about ruling Equestria, are you?

input: Twilight Sparkle: No. I know it took some time, but I've never been more ready for anything in my life. Just because I'm ready to sit on the throne in Canterlot, doesn't mean I'm ready to leave Ponyville. When we were all fighting to save Equestria from Tirek, Chrysalis, and Cozy Glow, I was too busy to think about it. But now it's all happening at once.
output: Spike: What is?

input: Twilight Sparkle: The coronation. Moving. Leaving our friends.
output: Spike: I thought we'd all be ruling Equestria together.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Of course we will, but it won't be the same. They all have lives here. We're moving away and they're not, and I can't help but feel like we're leaving them behind. What if we all just drift apart?
output: Spike: I guess I hadn't thought about it like that. Maybe you should talk to them. I bet they're feeling the same way.

input: Twilight Sparkle: So, you're not worried about how things might change with me living in Canterlot?
output: Applejack: Of course not. Change is natural, like the seasons. That's just life on the farm.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I guess so.
output: Applejack: Anyhoo, I really need to get all these boxes packed and sorted. There's a lot more work now that the folks beyond Equestria are comin' to the coronation, too.

input: Twilight Sparkle: But what about after the coronation? Don't you think things are gonna be different?
output: Pinkie Pie: Well, since I'll be in charge of all the Canterlot galas from now on, I'll have to go there a lot more. So I guess that's different, but I don't think I mind.

input: Twilight Sparkle: No. Of course not.
output: Fluttershy: Wonderful work, everyone! We couldn't be more ready. Josephine, if you and the rest of the doves leave now, we should all arrive in Canterlot at the same time.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Yeah. Me, neither.
output: Rainbow Dash: In three, two, one, and...

input: Twilight Sparkle: I don't think the Power Ponies care, Spike. Just like all of our friends.
output: Applejack: All right, Twilight. Are you ready? We all wanted to see you off, but there's still a lot to do.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Well, I'll be living in Canterlot alone. Might as well take the train alone, too. Bye, I guess.
output: Rarity: Oh, you won't be traveling alone, darling. I'll have just enough time on the train to weave the star spider sash for your gown. But we should leave now. There's no time to dawdle if you want the coronation to be perfect.

input: Twilight Sparkle: That's the problem! You're all so worried about making my coronation perfect, but I'm leaving Ponyville and none of you even care!
output: Luster Dawn: Exactly. You moved away, your friends didn't care, and that was that.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I tried to talk to you all about how I was feeling, but you seemed more worried about what you had to do for the coronation.
output: Spike: It's true. I was there.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Before I moved to Ponyville, I didn't really know what friendship was. You've all taught me so much. I can't believe it all might be ending. But when I imagine the future, all I can think about is that we won't be together! I'm literally moving away from you, and it's terrifying!
output: Fluttershy: I'm scared, too.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I know it's weird, but knowing you're all are as upset as I am actually makes me less worried.
output: Spike: That's nice, but you should be more worried about missing the train to Canterlot!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Okay. We're on the train. Everything should be fine, right?
output: Rarity: I'd worked out exactly how much time I needed to weave my star spider sash, and now I'm behind!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Well, it could always be worse.
output: Princess Luna: Goodness, Twilight. Are you all right?

input: Twilight Sparkle: My friends and I had a few hiccups on the way. But everything's fine now.
output: Princess Celestia: We really are both just so proud of you. If you need a moment, that's all right. It is your coronation.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Sorry.
output: Princess Luna: Um, Twilight?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Aah!
output: Applejack: To Twilight!

input: Twilight Sparkle: That was something.
output: Starlight Glimmer: I was just about to say the same thing. I know maybe it wasn't the coronation you planned, but it's good to see all of you laughing.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Awww.
output: Pinkie Pie: It's a book of memories.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I love it. Thank you so much. But I don't want to only look back. Obviously the coronation wasn't perfect, but that doesn't matter. It's our relationships that really count, and we have to maintain them.
output: Rarity: But now that we'll be living in different places, I'm not exactly sure how.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I am. I suggest we meet once a moon. In fact, my first royal decree as ruler of Equestria is to establish this Council of Friendship!
output: Princess Celestia: And what a wonderful decree it is!

input: Twilight Sparkle: You're leaving?
output: Princess Luna: We hope you'll come and visit us in Silver Shoals.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Thank you. For everything. Mmmm!
output: Luster Dawn: So, even though everything changed and you moved away from your friends, you didn't grow apart? And this is the Council of Friendship? That's what you're all doing here?

input: Twilight Sparkle: This happened while we were gone?
output: Applejack: Wow! Those are all the places we went when we left to save Equestria!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Tempest! I invited her to come to Ponyville, but she wanted to spread the word of the Storm King's defeat and share what she learned about friendship.
output: Applejack: Y'all think that's why the map grew? Friendship quests beyond Equestria?

input: Twilight Sparkle: We can't do it all alone.
output: Pinkie Pie: Sure we can! We just need to knock this wall down, get some paint...

input: Twilight Sparkle: No. I mean, the world is filled with so many different creatures who know nothing about friendship. We need help if we're gonna teach them all about friendship. Lots of help.
output: Rarity: Perhaps. But where does one go to learn about friendship?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Here! They can all go here! Because we're gonna open a school!
output: Princess Celestia: I think a school of friendship is a wonderful idea, Twilight! I'll help in any way I can.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I just have a few questions. What time should school start each day?
output: Princess Celestia: It really d—

input: Twilight Sparkle: What's the ideal length for class? Do you test regularly?
output: Princess Celestia: Oh, well, that's—

input: Twilight Sparkle: What about class projects?
output: Princess Celestia: That's a very—

input: Twilight Sparkle: Assigned seating? Open seating? Or is that... too unstructured?
output: Princess Celestia: Oh, Twilight. You were my star pupil. If anyone knows how to run a school, it's you.

input: Twilight Sparkle: There's a big difference between attending a school and running one. It's not like there's a rule book to follow.
output: Princess Celestia: Actually, there is. The EEA guidebook is very specific about how to run a school.

input: Twilight Sparkle: The EEA? I've never heard of that. Should I have heard of that?!
output: Princess Celestia: Of course not. You've never run a school before. The Equestria Education Association is a board of learned ponies that oversee every school in Equestria.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Okay, Spike, looks like we have a presentation to make.
output: Spike: After everything we've been through, how hard can that be?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Uh, hello. My name is—
output: Neighsay: Princess Twilight Sparkle. I am Chancellor Neighsay. Equestria owes you a great debt. But princess or no, we expect you to do things by... the... book!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I think you'll find my curriculum meets all your requirements, Chancellor.
output: Neighsay: And can we trust you to follow through with this plan? Will you leave the school unattended to gallop off on your... "adventures"?

input: Twilight Sparkle: If we want to keep our land safe and create a friendlier tomorrow, we need to teach the Magic of Friendship far and wide.
output: Neighsay: A school for ponies to learn how to protect themselves.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Uh, more like respecting differences and communicating.
output: Neighsay: The EEA concurs. Every pony should be prepared to defend our way of life. So, if your work is in order, provisional EEA approval is granted. We will need to observe your school up and running before it can be fully accredited.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Then please, join us for Friends and Family Day. It'll be the perfect time to see our progress!
output: Rainbow Dash: It's too much. Too much!

input: Twilight Sparkle: It's going to be fine. Everything about this school just feels right.
output: Starlight Glimmer: See? If Twilight isn't stressed, you've got nothing to worry about.

input: Twilight Sparkle: The EEA is very clear on how schools should be run. We have a huge responsibility, and I need you all to do this by the book. That means no cannons in class, Pinkie.
output: Pinkie Pie: Awww. Not even a teeny cannon?

input: Twilight Sparkle: I know it's not some big adventure against the forces of evil, but this could be the most important thing we've ever done. I can't run a school of friendship without my best friends. Can I count on you?
output: Rarity: Of course you can, darling.

input: Twilight Sparkle: About that. One thing I forgot to mention. It's not just ponies.
output: Pinkie Pie: That was unexpected.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Welcome to the School of Friendship! I'm your headmare Twilight Sparkle. Please follow Guidance Counselor Starlight to sign in and get your class assignments. Then we can show you your living quarters.
output: Sandbar: Whoa, sorry! I'm Sandbar. Are you a student here, too?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Looks like school's in session!
output: Silverstream: Is this what boring is? Am I bored?

input: Twilight Sparkle: I get it. Things are getting off to a rougher start than expected. But that's okay!
output: Spike: Who are you, and what have you done with Twilight Sparkle?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Every school in Equestria follows these rules. As long as we do too, we'll be fine.
output: Starlight Glimmer: Maybe we should... try something new?

input: Twilight Sparkle: The EEA will be here this afternoon for Friends and Family Day. They need to see a school that follows their guidelines.
output: Fluttershy: Even if those guidelines aren't working?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Another morning, another chance to inspire our students!
output: Sandbar: Hey! Professor Dash's class is this way.

input: Twilight Sparkle: My friends can handle anything. They'll have these problems turned around before we know it.
output: Neighsay: Problems?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Chancellor Neighsay! You're here!
output: Neighsay: Yes. And you seem unprepared. If there are problems...

input: Twilight Sparkle: Problems? Ha! Of course not! We can't wait to show you around!
output: Gallus: And that's why griffons breathe fire when we get mad.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Rainbow Dash! Why aren't you in class teaching?
output: Rainbow Dash: Because my students are gone! Uh, g-gone somewhere else! Doing a loyalty lesson! And-and I was just going to grab, uh... this pencil! Because they need it. Wherever they are. Which I know, 'cause... I'm the teacher!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I see. Well, Chancellor, we have other classes. We can just—
output: Neighsay: Let's follow the professor. I'm quite curious about this lesson in loyalty.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Of course, we want to instill a sense of loyalty towards others. We encourage acts of generosity and kindness.
output: Gallus: Figured we shouldn't be the only ones enjoying the view.

input: Twilight Sparkle: And appreciation for the value of laughter...
output: Yona: Flying is best!

input: Twilight Sparkle: ...and to always be honest in any situation.
output: Neighsay: Honesty is imperative. Princess, are we going in circles?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Uh, look at the time! We'd better head to the lake for Friends and Family Day. I'm sure all the students and faculty will be there.
output: Ember: What is that?!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I-I'm so sorry, Chancellor. We clearly had some students get a little carried away.
output: Neighsay: Those are students? But you said you were opening this school to protect Equestria! To defend ponies from... dangerous creatures who don't have our best interests at heart!

input: Twilight Sparkle: My school teaches for all of us to work together through friendship.
output: Neighsay: And how do you know these creatures won't take what they have learned here and use it against us?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Friendship isn't just for ponies!
output: Neighsay: It should be.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Princess Celestia helped me reach out to all the kingdoms! When she hears you closed the school because—!
output: Neighsay: Because you failed to meet the EEA's standards?

input: Twilight Sparkle: What?!
output: Neighsay: Irresponsible teachers, students skipping class, endangering ponies! Your school is a disaster. Perhaps if you had had higher standards for who was admitted, this could have been avoided. Regardless...

input: Twilight Sparkle: This happened while we were gone?
output: Applejack: Friendship quests beyond Equestria?

input: Twilight Sparkle: We're gonna open a school!
output: Neighsay: We expect you to do things by... the... book!

input: Twilight Sparkle: We have a huge responsibility, and I need you all to do this by the book.
output: Smolder: These ponies are the heroes of Equestria?

input: Twilight Sparkle: A failure vacation! I'm supposed to be the Princess of Friendship! And all I did was make enemies with Equestria's allies, upset my friends, and get my school... ...unaccredited! There is no bright side!
output: Spike: Okay, then. I'm gonna need backup. Operation Cheer-Up is a go!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Thanks, Rarity. It's a great dress... for somepony who knows how to run a school!
output: Pinkie Pie: You didn't tell me this was a pity party! I would've brought ice cream!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I appreciate you trying to make me feel better, but not everything can be fixed with dresses and cupcakes.
output: Pinkie Pie: What?!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Oh...
output: Starlight Glimmer: I wondered how long you'd take to get tired of pillow-fort pouting.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Everypony's already tried to cheer me up. It won't work.
output: Starlight Glimmer: I'm not gonna cheer you up. I'm gonna tell you what you did wrong.

input: Twilight Sparkle: What?!
output: Starlight Glimmer: You gave up too easily.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Neighsay was right. I failed. The school was a disaster.
output: Starlight Glimmer: So was I when you met me. But you showed me that when you know in your heart something is right, you stand up for it. You did that for me. Why not for this?

input: Twilight Sparkle: I can't go against the EEA! They're in charge of all the schools in Equestria!
output: Starlight Glimmer: And you're in charge of all the friendship in Equestria. Why should you let somepony else stop you from doing your job?

input: Twilight Sparkle: But the EEA rulebook—
output: Starlight Glimmer: Doesn't matter! You can write your own rules! Because you are doing something new. Something important!

input: Twilight Sparkle: You're right! Why we're doing this is way more important than how we're doing this! And we are doing this!
output: Starlight Glimmer: Now, that's the Twilight I know. How can I help?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Guess what? The School of Friendship is back in business!
output: Rainbow Dash: What?!
