output: Rainbow Dash: But it's like the harder I try to convince Scoot they're dangerous, the more she likes them!

input: Twilight Sparkle: You can't control her actions. Only yours. Teach her what's safe and what isn't, like a good role model. Then hope she makes the right decisions.
output: Rainbow Dash: But what if she chooses them over me? She's gonna get hurt!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I think I know somepony else who might get hurt if that happens.
output: Rainbow Dash: Um, maybe you're right. But this isn't about me. I'm just worried about Scoot.

input: Twilight Sparkle: That was awfully specific.
output: Lightning Dust: That's 'cause it's what she'll be doing in the show tonight. Half off for princesses! Bring your friends!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Scootaloo, are you sure that's what you really wanna do?
output: Scootaloo: Absolutely. And there's nothing you can do to stop me!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Of course, Professor Fossil! We'd be honored to have a Pillar of Equestria on our staff!
output: Professor Fossil: Oh, thank Celestia.

input: Twilight Sparkle: So, join me in welcoming Professor Rockhoof to our faculty!
output: Rockhoof: Thank you! Thank you, all! I know I'm new to your world, but there's one thing I learned when I saved my village from a rushing river of hot lava. There's nothing you can't do with hard work. And a shovel!

input: Twilight Sparkle: So, um... everycreature dismissed. We'll... see you in class!
output: Smolder: You think that new pony is gonna be the weirdest teacher at school or just one of the weirdest?

input: Twilight Sparkle: From what Professor Fossil said, it sounds like Rockhoof just hasn't settled into modern times yet. Our school is the perfect place for that. Plus, we get a new teacher.
output: Applejack: This may be the fastest friendship problem you ever solved.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Uh, Professor Rockhoof?
output: Rockhoof: Nope! Guess again! Uh, oops.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Our school is about finding your own special way to teach.
output: Applejack: And we can already tell you're a... smash with the class.

input: Twilight Sparkle: But maybe you could do a little less smashing in the classroom?
output: Rockhoof: Sorry about that. I did get a bit carried away. The students were so interested in my tale.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I know it's a big change. But I think you're gonna fit in just—
output: Rockhoof: Fire!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Rockhoof, wait!
output: Rockhoof: No time! The building's ablaze! We have to get everypony out!

input: Twilight Sparkle: What are you doing?!
output: Rockhoof: Savin' the school!

input: Twilight Sparkle: They do it all the time. That's what we were trying to tell you.
output: Applejack: We know you're used to bein' a hero, Rockhoof. Only what we need here is a teacher.

input: Twilight Sparkle: So apparently, finding Rockhoof a new job is a lot harder than we thought. Has anypony had any luck?
output: Applejack: I-I thought you were gonna try him out at the post office.

input: Twilight Sparkle: We did.
output: Rockhoof: Do you know where I can find Cranky Doodle Donkey?! I need to deliver his medicine! He has a rash in a very embarrassing place!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Great idea! Rockhoof's old friends would be happy to help. And I bet he'd love to visit them.
output: Rockhoof: Even Canterlot looks different from the old days.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Princess Celestia was happy to find a new drill sergeant for her guard!
output: Rockhoof: Uh... that's great. She really put you in a job that big so soon?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Your work is beautiful.
output: Mistmane: Oh, thank you. I've never worked with crystal before, but in my heart, I know I'm where I belong.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Somnambula's a motivational speaker. Bet they didn't even have those back in your time.
output: Rockhoof: Because we didn't need them. Ponies knew what to do with their lives.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Rockhoof? Where are you going?
output: Rockhoof: I'm not sure. Maybe I just don't belong in this modern world.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Hmm. I might know just the thing.
output: Rockhoof: I'm honored to serve in the Hippogriff Navy, General Seaspray! I promise I'll prove my worth.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Maybe they just like cruises?
output: Hippogriff Sailor: General! The fog's too thick to see our way out of the harbor!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Oh, no. Stars can move slowly over time. They must look different now than over a thousand years ago.
output: Seaspray: It was an honor serving with you, Rockhoof. But it seems our paths lie in different directions.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Hey, mistakes happen. We'll think of something else for you to do.
output: Rockhoof: Oh, there's no need, lass. I already know what I want to do next.

input: Twilight Sparkle: No!
output: Rockhoof: Yes!

input: Twilight Sparkle: No!
output: Rockhoof: Aye!

input: Twilight Sparkle: No!
output: Rockhoof: Aye!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Rockhoof wants me to cast a spell to turn him into a statue! The answer is no!
output: Rockhoof: Well, it should be "aye", because I wouldn't even be here to be turned into a statue if Twilight hadn't cast a spell in the first place!

input: Twilight Sparkle: The answer is still no! Why would you want to be turned into stone?
output: Rockhoof: Because I'm a relic of a bygone age. I belong in a museum. Safe. Preserved. Untouched. I don't belong in this time. It's up to you to make that right.

input: Twilight Sparkle: But there has to be a better way!
output: Rockhoof: Twilight, please understand. I want to be remembered as the hero I was, not the disappointment I've become.

input: Twilight Sparkle: But you're not! Rockhoof, wait! Spike, can you teach my class today?
output: Spike: Uh, you're not really going to turn him to stone, are you?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Only because it's temporary. As soon as I think of a new solution, we'll wake Rockhoof up. I know he has more to offer the world as a pony than a statue.
output: Sandbar: Did you hear Rockhoof caught all the bees in the Everfree Forest and gave 'em to Zecora as a gift?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Okay, I have the spell. But will you please reconsider? Rockhoof?
output: Rockhoof: The ursa major tried to grab me by the gullet! But I ducked her claws!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Wait. You said there wasn't anything in this time you were good at. What about telling stories?
output: Rockhoof: It was just a tall tale.

input: Twilight Sparkle: One that captured the hearts and imagination of everycreature here.
output: Yona: Plus, pony story super fun!

input: Twilight Sparkle: As the Princess of Friendship, I'd like to appoint you as Equestria's official keeper of tales!
output: Spike: Can you do that?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Eh.
output: Rockhoof: I, uh... That's very kind of you. But I still think these old bones are more suited to a museum display.

input: Twilight Sparkle: You are a living record of our history. Your stories can inspire and teach generations to come. If you're a statue, that's all lost.
output: Rockhoof: But will I ever really belong in your world?

input: Twilight Sparkle: The Tree of Harmony remains one of the most powerful sources of magic known to ponydom. And though it has been at the "root" of magic and friendship from the moment it was planted, its ways are mysterious. Almost as if it has a mind of its own.
output: Smolder: Mind? It's a tree.

input: Twilight Sparkle: A tree that grew a castle.
output: Silverstream: Was that before or after Discord made chocolate rain?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Remember! Study groups are both fun and effective!
output: Sandbar: So, who wants to study together?

input: Twilight Sparkle: I can't believe you two are going on a friendship quest! This is amazing!
output: Applejack: What do you mean, Twilight? We've been on one together before.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Exactly! This is the first time the map has teamed up the same ponies for a second quest!
output: Fluttershy: That is special.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I hope so, 'cause it looks like this one might be a little tricky. You're going to the Peaks of Peril.
output: Fluttershy: The Peaks of... P-P-Peril?!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Only what Rockhoof told me. Back in his day, nopony knew much about the Peaks of Peril except for the legend on this ancient shield. It says a group called the Kirin used to live there, known for their kindness and truth-speaking.
output: Applejack: Now we know why the Map called us.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Unfortunately, other creatures also lived there. The Nirik, fearsome beasts of pure fire.
output: Fluttershy: Maybe you should go instead of me, Twilight.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Sorry, Fluttershy. Flanks don't lie.
output: Applejack: Aw, I'm sure the two of us'll get that friendship problem solved, no matter what kind o' creature has it.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Woo-hoo-hoo!
output: Spike: Whoa! Ta-da!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Okay, Spike. Now let's try a flip. Remember – two flaps, then straight up!
output: Spike: Got it!

input: Twilight Sparkle: You're doing great, Spike. Now let's see the big finish!
output: Spike: Whoa-oa-oa-oa!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Maybe I should get Rainbow Dash. She's the one who taught me advanced flying techniques.
output: Spike: No, thanks. If I'm gonna mess up, I'd rather do it in front of you. I just don't understand why none of your advice is helping.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Spike, I've been thinking about our flying lesson.
output: Spike: Uh-huh...

input: Twilight Sparkle: I can't believe I overlooked something as simple as feathers. It's no wonder you were having trouble. I wish I had more "dragonish" knowledge to give you. Do you think being raised by ponies has affected you in other ways? Spike?
output: Spike: Did you say something, Twilight? Sorry. I'm just finishing up this "thank-you" throw pillow for Smolder. And you know how I get when I'm in the embroidery zone.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I'm glad Spike brought you here, Sludge. I understand you made quite the impression in town.
output: Pinkie Pie: Literally! There's a hole and everything!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I know you had your reservations, but it's good to see you feeling better.
output: Sludge: T-Thanks, I guess.

input: Twilight Sparkle: We try our best, but sometimes I worry that maybe Spike is...
output: Spike: Missing something deep down and dragonish.

input: Twilight Sparkle: So you crashed in Ponyville on purpose?
output: Sludge: Well, the crash part wasn't on purpose, but heading here was. I've been searching everywhere for you, kid.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Also, the Hippogriffs returned to Mount Aris after we helped them defeat the Storm King.
output: Sludge: Oh, well, have you heard of the Land of the... Scale Collectors?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Uh-uh.
output: Sludge: Because that's where your mother's trail finally led.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Hey, Spike! How are things going with Sludge?
output: Spike: Honestly, I thought having him around would make me feel more dragonish. But I kind of feel less.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Oh, I'm sorry. I wish I could help.
output: Sludge: Awww, shucks. I guess I shouldn't have said anything about you being more pony than dragon. I just wish we had more in common.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Maybe you two can come up with ways to turn up Spike's, uh, dragonishness.
output: Spike: You think that's something we can do?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Oh! I'm so sorry! I didn't mean to barge in on ya!
output: Sludge: Ah, don't worry about it. Mi castle es su castle.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Oh! Spike! I'm so sorry. My morning is not going well. What is all this? Why'd you leave the castle so early?
output: Spike: I didn't leave. I spent the night outdoors to get in touch with my dragon side.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Outdoors?
output: Spike: Yeah! And Sludge asked me to bring him the best breakfast Ponyville has to offer so he can show me how a real dragon would eat it. See you later!

input: Twilight Sparkle: ...And that's why I thought we could use the map to—
output: Spike: Hey, gang! Dad was just showing me how a real dragon would act in a throne room.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I'm glad you're not spending the night outside again.
output: Spike: Oh, I am. I'm just looking for a good bedtime story to read to my dad first.

input: Twilight Sparkle: It's nice that you have somepony to show you dragon culture. But are you sure that's what Sludge is doing?
output: Spike: What do you mean?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Well, taking over your room, making a mess of things...
output: Spike: That is dragon culture.

input: Twilight Sparkle: You never acted like that.
output: Spike: That's because you raised me. Now I finally have a chance to see how I'm supposed to be.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I don't think you're supposed to be any different than who you are.
output: Spike: Maybe you just don't like that I have a real parent now.

input: Twilight Sparkle: That's not true! I'm glad Sludge is here. I-I just wish he wasn't such a—
output: Spike: Dragon? Of all ponies, I can't believe you would have a problem with that.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Oh. Hi. Where's your father?
output: Spike: He's gone. Turns out he wasn't what a real dragon should be after all. He also wasn't my real dad.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Oh, Spike. I'm so sorry.
output: Spike: I'm the one who's sorry. You were just worried about me, and I lost my temper. Sludge was just a great big phony.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I have to say, I'm not surprised. There's no way a dragon like that was related to you. But if you still want to search for your real family, I'd understand if you spent more time in the Dragon Lands.
output: Spike: I don't think so. I already know who my real family is.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Aww! It's me, right?
output: Spike: Mm-hmm! Besides, there's no way I'm living without pillows.

input: Twilight Sparkle: The mail's here already? What time is it?! I'm late for my class's field trip to Cloudsdale!
output: Cozy Glow: Don't worry. I asked Professor Rainbow Dash to cover for you.

input: Twilight Sparkle: And she said yes?
output: Cozy Glow: Uh-huh. I told her how busy you are and how much her loyalty meant to you. I also color-coded your teaching schedule by friendship element and catalogued all the magical artifacts in the school. I hope that's okay.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Okay? Cozy, that's amazing! You're like my right-hoof pony! I don't know what I'd do without you.
output: Cozy Glow: It's like you taught me. Helping is what friendship's all about.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Exactly. And hopefully my class is learning that on their field trip right now.
output: Cozy Glow: I heard they might do some sightseeing first.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Slow down. What happened?
output: Starlight Glimmer: I cast a spell for our field trip to Cloudsdale, but my magic just failed.

input: Twilight Sparkle: I didn't drop that book.
output: Starlight Glimmer: Maybe you did your spell wrong?

input: Twilight Sparkle: This doesn't make any sense. Magic can't just disappear. Something has to be causing this.
output: Cozy Glow: Um, didn't we learn in class about a creature that eats magic? Ter, Tee... Tir-something?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Spike, what's wrong?
output: Spike: Thanks. I've never had a letter get stuck before. It's from Princess Celestia! We've all been called to an emergency meeting in Canterlot! Look!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Pretty sure I know what it's about.
output: Princess Celestia: Throughout our city, ponies have been reporting tales of their magic failing. Spells going wrong. Potions not working.

input: Twilight Sparkle: We experienced it first-hoof.
output: Princess Cadance: It's the same in my kingdom. The Crystal Heart seems safe for now, but I worry if this continues.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Has anypony checked on Tirek?
output: Pinkie Pie: You mean the big, red, scary centaur who eats magic? Why would we wa— Ohhhh. Riiiiight.

input: Twilight Sparkle: We'll go.
output: Rarity: Oh, no-no-no-no-no-no. Not without us, you wo— Wait. Did you say "we"?

input: Twilight Sparkle: I've finally learned that it's okay to count on your friends for help. Um, you do want to come, right?
output: Rainbow Dash: Uh, duh!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Okay. I left you my lesson plan, all my student files, and my annotated syllabus notes. If anything goes wrong, get Celestia.
output: Starlight Glimmer: Got it!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Maybe I should just close the school and send my students home.
output: Starlight Glimmer: Would you go save Equestria already?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Plus, she'll have you to help her.
output: Cozy Glow: Oh, golly, yes! I promise I'll be the best assistant ever! Come on. We can start working on your substitute headmare plans right now, if you like.

input: Twilight Sparkle: See? Nothing to worry about. Tell me there's nothing to worry about.
output: Cozy Glow: Good morning, friendship students! I know we're all sad Professor Sparkle is away. But don't worry, because she left me in charge to do things just the way she would.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Have you tried using your tail to shoo them away?
output: Rarity: Bite your tongue! It's for decorative purposes only!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I think we have all the magic we need right here. Not that I don't want to get it back. Heh. Let's go!
output: "Citrine Spark": Cozy Glow baked our class cupcakes today!

input: Twilight Sparkle: This is the only door to Tartarus. The good news is the seal isn't broken, so we know Tirek didn't escape.
output: Applejack: Let me guess. You got bad news, too?

input: Twilight Sparkle: Last time I was here, I had to use magic to get in. And according to Star Swirl, all unicorn magic was gone by yesterday's sunset.
output: Rainbow Dash: Maybe he was wrong.

input: Twilight Sparkle: The Key of Unfettered Entrance! Where did you find this, Spike?
output: Spike: In your bag. Cozy Glow must've packed it for you.

input: Twilight Sparkle: She really did think of everything.
output: Fluttershy: Um, what does it do?

input: Twilight Sparkle: I guess it only works once.
output: Applejack: Cockatrice!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Star Swirl said that would happen on the second day.
output: Spike: I know it should make me feel safer, but it just makes me sad. We gotta fix this!

input: Twilight Sparkle: We want answers, Tirek. Magic is disappearing from Equestria.
output: Lord Tirek: I know. What a waste of such... ...mmmm, delicious power.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Where is Equestria's magic going, Tirek? What's making it disappear?
output: Lord Tirek: If you let me out, I'm sure it will jog my memory. What do you say? I scratch your back, you scratch mine?

input: Twilight Sparkle: We'll go.
output: Gallus: I thought Starlight Glimmer was gonna be temporary headmare.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Cozy Glow is behind all of this?!
output: Lord Tirek: I'm not usually a fan of ponies, but draining your precious world of magic so she could trap the six of you was inspiring!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I knew we shouldn't have left!
output: Applejack: But Starlight's in charge at the school. If anypony can stop Cozy Glow, it's her.

input: Twilight Sparkle: We have to get out of here. Her students can't handle Cozy on their own.
output: Rainbow Dash: Then I guess we'll just have to bust our way out!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Unless... These creatures might be losing their magical powers, but there's still a magic that makes up what they are. Maybe we can borrow some of that.
output: Cozy Glow: Uh, excuse me? Um, Chancellor Neighsay?

input: Twilight Sparkle: We need to try everything if we want to get out of here.
output: Pinkie Pie: I don't know. Tartarus isn't so bad. I could hang out here for a while!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Have you even thought about what losing magic would mean?
output: Lord Tirek: It means the six of you will be trapped here! Like me!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Exactly. It means you're trapped here. Forever. With us.
output: Lord Tirek: Uhhhh... I hadn't thought of it like that.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Dash and Applejack nearly have Cerberus tired out. If Rarity pitches in, I think they can get him to sit still long enough to try what I have in mind.
output: Fluttershy: I'm sure I can get the other monsters to help. Besides, I would never call them monsters.

input: Twilight Sparkle: All right. Is everypony ready?
output: Rarity: Sit! Good! I can't say for how much longer.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Come on! I don't know how long I can hold it!
output: Rainbow Dash: Good boy!

input: Twilight Sparkle: I couldn't have done it without all your help.
output: Rarity: I'm not sure we did!

input: Twilight Sparkle: No!
output: Applejack: Tirek said all of Equestria's magic would be gone at sunset.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Without magic, there's no way we'll get back to the school in time!
output: Fluttershy: What does that mean?

input: Twilight Sparkle: It means... we've failed!
output: Cozy Glow: After everything Twilight's done for you, why would you want to destroy her school?

input: Twilight Sparkle: But I still don't understand why.
output: Cozy Glow: Why?! Because friendship is power! You might be the Princess of Friendship, but as headmare of this school, I can collect even more friends than you!

input: Twilight Sparkle: You're the one who doesn't get it, Cozy. Friendship is powerful, but power isn't why you make friends. I'm sorry I couldn't teach you that.
output: Gallus: Well, you taught us.

input: Twilight Sparkle: What's going on?
output: Silverstream: Hi, Headmare Twilight! We're just practicing for graduation!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Graduation?
output: Gallus: Now that we've saved Equestria, we figure we're done with school.

input: Twilight Sparkle: Saving Equestria is nice, but I'm afraid it'll take more than one semester to learn all there is to know about friendship.
output: Spike: Told ya.

input: Twilight Sparkle: If it were easy to learn, we wouldn't need a school.
output: Apple Bloom: We held her off as long as we could!

input: Twilight Sparkle: Everything worked out just fine.
output: Princess Celestia: As for Cozy Glow, I can assure you — where she's going, she won't be causing any more trouble.
